alert.note: Alert for Martin (Minnesota) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued August 16 at 9:01PM CDT until August 16 at 9:15PM CDT by NWS Minneapolis
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 915 PM CDT FOR CENTRAL MARTIN COUNTY... At 901 PM CDT, a severe thunderstorm was located over Welcome, or 6 miles west of Fairmont, moving southeast at 45 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts and half dollar size hail. SOURCE...Public reported hail slightly larger than a quarter. IMPACT...Hail damage to vehicles is expected. Expect wind damage to roofs, siding, and trees. This severe thunderstorm will remain over mainly rural areas of central Martin County, including the following locations... Foxlake. TORNADO...POSSIBLE HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.25 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building.
